They review medical histories, conduct thorough physical examinations, and order diagnostic tests such as imaging studies and biopsies to establish accurate diagnoses.                Treatment Planning and Decision-making    : They participate in developing individualized treatment plans for patients based on their specific cancer type, stage, and overall health. Treatment options may include surgery, chemotherapy, radiation therapy, targeted therapy, and immunotherapy.                Surgical Expertise    : Associate Consultants perform surgical procedures to remove gynecologic tumors and cancerous tissues. These surgeries may include hysterectomy (removal of the uterus), oophorectomy (removal of the ovaries), lymph node dissection, and debulking surgery to remove as much tumor tissue as possible.                Chemotherapy and Radiation Therapy    : They oversee the administration of chemotherapy and radiation therapy for gynecologic cancers. This may involve prescribing chemotherapy regimens, monitoring treatment responses, and managing treatment-related side effects.                Postoperative Care and Follow-up    : After surgery and other treatments, Associate Consultants provide comprehensive postoperative care and follow-up to monitor patients' recovery progress, assess treatment outcomes, and address any complications or concerns that may arise.                Palliative Care    : They collaborate with palliative care specialists to manage symptoms and improve the quality of life for patients with advanced or metastatic gynecologic cancers. Palliative care focuses on symptom management, pain relief, and emotional support for patients and their families.
